definition: to mock/to be ridiculed/to incur ridicule through one's poor performance (humble)
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: Chinese is not my mother tongue, so if I've written something wrong or offended someone, I wish all of you could excuse me.
sentences.chinese: 如果我有什么写错或者有得罪的地方，请诸位别见笑。

sentences.english: The following are the pictures of the day. No good shootings. Just view the way you like.
sentences.chinese: 下面是这天活动的照片，拍得不好，见笑了。

sentences.english: Just kidding. How can I compare myself with them?
sentences.chinese: 见笑，见笑。我哪儿能跟他们比？

sentences.english: Just kidding. How can I compare myself with them?
sentences.chinese: 见笑，见笑。我哪儿能跟他们比？

sentences.english: Code is written in a rough look not laughed.
sentences.chinese: 代码写的比较粗糙望不要见笑。

sentences.english: At the risk of showing my ignorance, how exactly does the Internet work?
sentences.chinese: 不怕让你见笑了，可究竟互联网是怎么运作的呢？

sentences.english: When all the other flowers bloom, She just smile among them.
sentences.chinese: 括号里的可以省略，还是很粗浅，见笑。

definition: lit. I dare not (accept the honor); fig. I don't deserve your praise/you flatter me
to let sb down/to be unfair/I'm sorry/pardon me (formal)
lit. I'm ashamed and dare not (accept the honor); fig. I do not deserve your praise./You flatter me too much.
(humble expr.) of humble talent and shallow learning (idiom); Pray forgive my ignorance,...
you let me win (said politely after winning a game)
to calm down/to quell one's anger
